reviewerName: Dan E. Nicholas "gotta have a book"
reviewText: A decision to buy this DVD and the book that goes with got us down to the Getty in LA to see the exhibit of St. Catherine's there...and made us vow to go someday soon to that ancient place in Egypt as well as the Holy Land.  We met Fr. Justin there at the Getty and made plans to do the trip to Egypt, to come see him at St. Catherine's.  My, my.  He even let us in to the 2nd oldest library in the world, as he is the librarian.  I'm told one in a million pilgrims get that opportunity.So, be careful.  You will be inspired if you watch this video.  When I saw in the flick that Bruce Feiler set his clock there in Egypt to rise at dark thirty in time for service and in time to climb Moses Mountain for the fabled sunrise at the top.  I started working to rise early like the monks do.  It's hard but worth it to get up before dawn to work on your soul.Yes, indeed,some books and videos change the way you live and travel and spend money and dream.  This book and the matching video are such works.I'm also enjoying now the monastery of St. Catherine experience set down in another book I'm reading: Inner River by Markides.  If you are Orthodox or not, watch this Feiler documentary video.  Read his companion book, too.  Go there.  At your own risk!
summary: good but pricey.  Cost me a trip to the Holy Land!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I saw parts of this at a Bible study at church and knew I wanted it in my collection.I probably can never make a trip to the Holy Land but would love to walk where Abraham, Isaac, Jabob and Jesus walked. Well you can with this.The scenery is breathtaking and you will learn so much. The first 5 books of the Bible will come alive to you. It is like you are there. The guide is Jewish and the personal insights he shares are very inspiring. He teaches the history and the truth but he also shares his heart.If you want to get excited and connectd to the Old Testament this is a must.
summary: Wonderful way to EXPERIENCE the Bible.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an excellent documentary of the Holy Land and shows actual footage of Jerusalem. Would like to someday travel to the Holy Land, but until then I plan to purchase everything depicting Jerusalem and the holy sites. I have viewed DVD multiple times and have gained more knowledge than before. Would 100% recommend this DVD and plan to purchase more to give as gifts to family, friends, Christians and non-Christians. The host is himself Jewish and came with a lot of credibility in discussing the Torah.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I collect a ton of video about the Bible. This video doesn't have much weight to it. It is about a guy who travels to "supposed" Biblical locations which are known to be incorrect. However, what most people don't understand is how these "Biblical" sites were decided. These sites were created hundreds of years later by religious leaders and people connected to the emperor of Rome, not experienced archeologists like we have in the 21st century. Most of the actual Biblical sites have been found, but most people don't believe in the new sites because once you have thousands of years of tradition, it is hard to break. Check out the video called "Revealing God's Treasure, Collectors Edition, Featuring the Discoveries of Ron Wyatt."
summary: Not a fan of this video
